translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir,

On the 17th of the current month, at 4 o'clock in the afternoon, I departed from this city with 90 cavalrymen and about 60 infantrymen, German volunteers, embarked on two boats and two barges; and facing the islands, there, according to orders, the 3rd boat joined me, with about 40 cavalry and 3 war barges commanded by Naval Lieutenant Rocha; and proceeding all under my command, I made a landing on the 18th, at 4 o'clock in the morning, at Santa Cruz; and thence I marched, with 40 cavalrymen on horseback and the said infantry commanded by Captain Christe, about one league along the coast of the Ratos stream, where I ordered a false path to be made, and through it I crossed the people with great difficulty, in two canoes, for which I had the saddles of horses carried along the shore.

Having completed the crossing, I divided the force and ordered several points to be surrounded, with the rebel guard at the mouth of the Ratos stream, at the Leão farm and its drying yard; and with success in all parts, seven rebels were killed, among them the Legion Colonel José Manuel de Leão and the assassin Antônio Turpim, and nine were taken prisoners, including Lieutenant Jerônimo and Ensign Inocêncio, about one hundred cavalry horses and about one hundred head of cattle, including many tame oxen, some weapons and about one hundred and some cartridges packed, one arroba of lead number B and seven bundles of white-handled knives, each bundle consisting of 25 knives; the cartridges, lead, knives, and 43 hair-on leather hides I delivered to the said Lieutenant Rocha.

With the arrival of Your Excellency Leão, with the 8th Battalion, I followed Your Excellency's orders to Ponta Rasa, and the other horses to the island of the Detachment, and one cattle boat and tame oxen for this capital. All the officers, subordinate officers, and soldiers who accompanied me conducted themselves with great activity, subordination, and valor, distinctly standing out were Lieutenant Isaías, Ensign Carvalho, and Corporal Fidélis Pais da Silva.

The activity of Naval Lieutenant Rocha is also much to be praised, as well as that of all the other navy men who accompanied me. I shall not be more lengthy because Your Excellency...

Porto Alegre, September 21, 1839.

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Filipe Neri de Oliveira, Brigadier and Commander of the Brigade.

Francisco Pedro de Abreu.

Death of Colonel José Manuel de Leão.
